WRITING.TITLE: I got an interview at SBU for their ABSN!!! Has anyone else gone through this before?
WRITING.TEXT: As I said in the title, I just got the call from Stony Brook that they want me to come in for an interview. They said it will consist of a math proficiency test, a reading comprehension test, and a group interview. I'm so excited and nervous at the same time. Has anyone else done an interview for nursing school and feel like sharing their wisdom? Also, a big thank you to all the beautiful people of r/studentnurse that helped me with my personal statement.
that was heartbreaking.

Are we the same person? Im graduating in may with basically the same major(health and human services), and I want to get into one year nursing program. What program did you apply to if you don't mind me asking?
Thank you!!
thank you, this is very very helpful :)
Hi yourself! Best of luck to you :)
Hmm, that's interesting about adding a bullet before answering each prompt. And I actually had it proof read by two people, aha. Are there a lot of errors they missed?
Are there any parts in particular you feel are unnecessary?

WRITING.TITLE: Personal Statement for an accelerated program help?
WRITING.TEXT: Hi there! I'm applying for an accelerated nursing program for second degree students and was wondering if anyone would mind reading over my personal statement and giving some constructive criticism? I would really appreciate it, I'm not sure if it's acceptable or not. It's still a work on progress. The promt is on the top, and the program asked for 3-5 pages. Thanks in advance!!

k_tea, you are correct, EDNOS instead of bulimia. For some reason I thought she mentioned binging. However, that does not make the situation any less serious, getting help is still very very necessary.

Bulimia Nervosa
from the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders
Diagnostic criteria for 307.51 Bulimia Nervosa
A. Recurrent episodes of binge eating. An episode of binge eating is characterized by both of the following: (1) Eating, in a discrete period of time (e.g., within any 2-hour period), an amount of food that is definitely larger than most people would eat during a similar period of time and under similar circumstances (2) a sense of lack of control over eating during the episode (e.g., a feeling that one cannot stop eating or control what or how much one is eating)
B. Recurrent inappropriate compensatory behavior in order to prevent weight gain, such as self-induced **vomiting**; misuse of laxatives, diuretics, enemas, or other medications; fasting; or excessive exercise.
C. The binge eating and inappropriate compensatory behaviors both occur, on average, **at least twice a week for 3 months**. (I would not say I'm bulimic but I am known to puke up meals if I feel guilty about what I've eaten... say a few or more times a week.)
D. **Self-evaluation is unduly influenced by body shape and weight.** ( know I'm on the thin size (think 120ish at 5'8) but every time I see myself in the mirror I feel like shit) Your BMI is 18.2. Anything below 18.5 is concidered underweight.
E. The disturbance does not occur exclusively during episodes of Anorexia Nervosa.
Specify type: Purging Type: during the current episode of Bulimia Nervosa, the person has regularly engaged in self-induced vomiting or the misuse of laxatives, diuretics, or enemas
Nonpurging Type: during the current episode of Bulimia Nervosa, the person has used other inappropriate compensatory behaviors, such as fasting or excessive exercise, but has not regularly engaged in self-induced vomiting or the misuse of laxatives, diuretics, or enemas****
source:http://www.eating.ucdavis.edu/eatdis/bulimia/bulim_char/buldsm.html
http://www.allianceforeatingdisorders.com/ http://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/ http://therapists.psychologytoday.com/rms/prof_search.php
Please, please please get help. If you want you can pm me, I've had my share fair of trouble with this particular devil. If I'm being too pushy I apologize. This disorder is very hard to kick without help, and while your boyfriend IS a hugeeee ass, you have bigger problems right now. Don't minimalize it, or rationalize it away. It won't disappear unless you make it leave.
seriously, this. planned parenthood is wonderful, and they have reduced fee or free services for those in financial need.
